zone.line: Dark purple at the zenith, which still grew
Down the steep west into a wondrous hue
Brighter than burning gold, even to the rent
had
Where the swift sun paused in his descent
Among the many-folded hills; they were
Those famous Euganean hills, which bear,
As seen from Lido thro the harbour piles,
The likeness of a clump of conic isles —
the
And then — as if from earth & sea had been
Dissolved into one lake of fire, were seen
Those mountains rising as from waves of flame
Around the vapourous sun, from whch. there came
The inmost purple spirit of light, & made
Their peaks transparent: "Ere it fade,"
Said my companion, "I will shew you soon
"A better station" — so o'er the lagune
We glided, & from that funereal bark
I leaned, & saw the city & could mark
